did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The Perry Brass papers consist of handwritten and typescript drafts of letters, articles, prose pieces, theatrical writings, diaries, poems, and essays, as well as photographs, publicity and promotional materials, scripts, letters to Brass from friends and family, and printed versions of articles as they appeared in various gay magazines. Most of the material in the collection is concerned with gay themes and the relationship between the gay and straight cultures; the correspondence also most often pertains to gay society, relations, or theatrical and literary milieus.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Perry Brass was born in Savannah, Georgia in 1947. He graduated from New York University in 1974, having studied art education. As a gay playwright, writer, and essayist, Brass' most successful work was the theater piece "All Men" which was produced in New York City, Los Angeles, and Chicago, in 1987 and 1988.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Manuscript versions of Brass' plays, stories, novels, and articles, mostly with gay male themes, including stage directions, programs, press releases and other promotional material for some of the plays, notably "All Men"; typescript of unpublished novel; original screenplay This is All of US, 1970; copies of COME OUT!, which Brass wrote for and published; professional and gay movement correspondence; course materials; and miscellaneous professional papers. Personal papers include a 1968 journal; student papers from NYU, 1971-1973; photographs; and personal and family correspondence.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Perry Brass papers, #7329. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

acqinfo.head: PROVENANCE
acqinfo.p: The collection was received from Perry Brass in multiple installments in 1989 and 1992.

arrangement.head: COLLECTION ARRANGEMENT
arrangement.p: As the collection arrived at the Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections at Cornell, there was no evident or particular organization other than the one Brass provided to identify the components of his several donations. As with "All Men," which he called a "structuralist performance piece," Brass kept unlike forms together. These might include drafts of letters, ideas for essays, fragments of theatrical pieces, other forms of writing, and other material. These usually have a chronological integrity.

It is particularly useful to consider Brass' descriptive notes that accompanied each of the donations. These frequently became reminiscences or interpretations, and provide valuable insight into the works. These are located in
Box 1, folder 58. Wherever possible, notation of the correspondence is made between Brass' original folder designations, and the current archival configurations. Other connections can be inferred.
The terms "holograph" and "manuscript" are for the purposes of this collection interchangeable.

did.unittitle: Letters to Perry Brass, from Rick Paul, Will Inman, Louise Landy, George Michell, Betty Deal, Christopher Hewitt, and others, 1987-1989
Personal and Family Letters and Papers, 1969-1974
Correspondence, Clippings, and typescript of "Men Keep House" 1987
Correspondence, photographs, poems, notes, and invoices, undated
Varied-Subject Pad, including drafts of letters, lists, synopsis of "The Chinese Monkey Feast," versions of "At Death's Door," "PCP," a poem inspired by Tom Finley, and other writings
"All Men" stage notes, program, and notes

"All Men" material: Flyers, biographical note, press release, programs, flyers, posters, Christin Bjorn photograph, publicity and promotional material, notes, and reviews, and an interview of Stan Leventhal and Perry Brass
Manuscript of Jimmie, an unpublished novel
"Gay Success" manuscript and printed version in Advocate Men
"On Being Bullied" manuscript and printed version in Torso
"Notes from a Gay Playwright: manuscript and typescript
"A Blow Job is for Real" manuscript
Varied-Subject Pad, including articles for Stan Leventhal, letters, "Southern Sissy Boy," "Men and Manners" and other writings

Varied-Subject Pad, including "The Golden Pavilion" manuscript (later called
"Spies in the Golden Pavilion"), drafts of letters, and a list ("New in the 60's")
"The Death of My Friend Tom" manuscript; "Summer on Christopher Street" manuscript
Cover (only) of "Survival Kit - A complete Guidance Manual for Gay Men Everywhere" edited by Perry Brass and Lou Thomas
Draft of a letter to the New York Transit Authority, and list of stories
Lists of venues, poems, bus instructions, and a "Statement of Purpose"
"The Cold" manuscript, with printed version in Advocate Men
"Bargello" and "Souffle" (two interlinked, one-act plays), manuscript and typescript
"Unmasking Straight Men" printed version in Torso
"Gay Anxiety" and "Men Keep House" manuscripts; draft of a letter to Greg Baysans of "The James White Review" and others; preparation notes

Miscellaneous pieces: draft of a letter to the editor; aphorisms, riddles, and short written pieces on cards; printed version of "The Cincinnati Connection Ballet Comes Alive!"; "Five Gay Plays"; mosaic promotional page for "Urban Fables and Verses"; "Osiris, the Dog Star"; and "The Enticing Lane" by Christopher Hewitt
Wings Theatre Company broadside and poster for "All Men"
Typescript of "This Is All Of Us"
Red-bound spiral drawing tablets, some with homoerotic drawings, 1972-1973
Prescription for Love by "Nancy Gwendolyn Bell" typescript
Drafts of short stories, correspondence, miscellany, c.1966-1967
Draft manuscripts, typescripts, poems, and miscellaneous writings
"Here, There, and Yonder," a trilogy of one act plays
"The Most Beautiful Man in the World"

Notebooks of draft prose fictions, including "Book Talks - Maugham," "Movers and Shakers," "Mother's Boys," "Take it Slow," "The Freighter Story," "Night Chills," and "The Most Beautiful Man in the World"
Notebooks of drafts of "The Seventeenth Summer"
Notebooks of "Set" poem, "The Boathouse," "The Self-Expression Factor," "Bargello," "Poetry Education," and "The Body Queens"
Photographs of Brass, friends and lovers
Miscellany, including theatre programs, broadside, poem, letter from the Netherlands, photographs, and woodcut
Miscellany, including passport, slides, negatives, and photographs
